steps.title: Ensure Safety and Assess the Situation
steps.description: Make sure the area is safe for both the rescuer and the victim. Check if the person is conscious and breathing normally.

steps.title: Have the Person Rest
steps.description: Help the victim sit or lie down in a comfortable position, ideally semi-upright. Encourage them to stay calm and still.

steps.title: Loosen Tight Clothing
steps.description: Loosen belts, collars, or restrictive clothing to help breathing and circulation.

steps.title: Monitor the Victim
steps.description: Observe vital signs such as breathing, consciousness, and pulse. Watch for symptoms worsening (sweating, nausea, dizziness, fainting).

steps.title: Administer Emergency Medication (if prescribed)
steps.description: If the victim has prescribed medication for chest pain (e.g., nitroglycerin), assist in taking it as directed.

steps.title: Call for Emergency Help
steps.description: Contact professional medical services immediately if pain is severe, persistent, or accompanied by other symptoms (shortness of breath, sweating, nausea, radiating pain).

steps.title: Prepare for CPR if Necessary
steps.description: If the victim becomes unconscious and stops breathing, begin CPR immediately.
